alert.note: Alert for Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Brevard, southeastern Orange and northeastern Osceola Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over the Saint Johns River on the Orange-Brevard County line that is nearly stationary. A strong outflow boundary ahead of this storm is moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cocoa, Wedgefield, Avalon Park, Lone Cabbage Fish Camp and Christmas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
